overview.brief_description: Cannes is the epitome of French Riviera glamour, a sophisticated coastal city known worldwide for its prestigious film festival, luxury boutiques, and pristine beaches. This elegant resort town combines Mediterranean charm with high-end sophistication, offering visitors a taste of the jet-set lifestyle along the stunning Côte d'Azur.

sections.title: Film Festival Fame
sections.content: Cannes is globally renowned for hosting the prestigious Cannes Film Festival each May, where the world's most celebrated filmmakers, actors, and industry professionals gather on the iconic red carpet of the Palais des Festivals. This annual event transforms the city into the epicenter of international cinema.

sections.title: Luxury Shopping
sections.content: The famous La Croisette boulevard is lined with high-end boutiques from the world's most prestigious fashion houses, including Chanel, Dior, and Louis Vuitton. Cannes offers an unparalleled shopping experience for luxury goods and designer fashion.

sections.title: Mediterranean Beaches
sections.content: Cannes boasts some of the French Riviera's most beautiful beaches, from the public Plage du Midi to exclusive private beach clubs. The crystal-clear waters and golden sands provide the perfect setting for sunbathing, swimming, and water sports.

sections.title: Historic Old Town
sections.content: Le Suquet, Cannes' historic quarter, offers a charming contrast to the modern glamour of La Croisette. This medieval district features narrow cobblestone streets, the 11th-century Tour du Suquet, and authentic Provençal restaurants with panoramic views.

why_visit.intro: Cannes offers visitors the perfect blend of French Riviera sophistication and Mediterranean charm, making it an ideal destination for those seeking luxury, culture, and beautiful coastal scenery.

highlights.title: La Croisette Promenade
highlights.content: Stroll along the iconic La Croisette, a palm-lined boulevard that epitomizes Cannes' glamorous atmosphere. This famous promenade offers stunning views of the Mediterranean, luxury hotels, and the elegant Palais des Festivals where the film festival takes place.

highlights.title: Le Suquet Historic Quarter
highlights.content: Explore the charming medieval quarter of Le Suquet, where narrow streets lead to the historic Tour du Suquet and the Église Notre-Dame de l'Espérance. This area offers authentic Provençal atmosphere and spectacular panoramic views of the bay.

highlights.title: Îles de Lérins
highlights.content: Take a short boat ride to the peaceful Îles de Lérins, where you can visit the historic Fort Royal on Île Sainte-Marguerite and the serene Île Saint-Honorat with its active monastery. These islands offer a peaceful escape from the city's bustle.

highlights.title: Palais des Festivals
highlights.content: Visit the iconic Palais des Festivals, home to the world-famous Cannes Film Festival. Even outside festival season, you can walk up the famous red carpet steps and explore the building's impressive architecture and history.

highlights.title: Luxury Shopping
highlights.content: Experience world-class shopping along La Croisette and Rue d'Antibes, where you'll find flagship stores from the world's most prestigious fashion houses. Cannes is a paradise for luxury shopping and fashion enthusiasts.

highlights.title: Mediterranean Beaches
highlights.content: Relax on Cannes' beautiful beaches, from the public Plage du Midi to exclusive private beach clubs like Plage du Martinez. The warm Mediterranean waters and golden sands provide the perfect setting for a day of sun and sea.

transport.public_transport: Cannes has an efficient bus network connecting the city center with surrounding areas. The city is also well-connected by train to other French Riviera destinations. Most attractions in the city center are easily walkable.
transport.passes: Consider purchasing a day pass for unlimited bus travel around Cannes and nearby areas.

spring.description: Spring brings pleasant temperatures and blooming landscapes to Cannes. The city awakens from winter, with outdoor cafés reopening and beaches becoming more accessible. This is an ideal time for exploring without the summer crowds.
considerations: Some seasonal businesses may still be closed

summer.description: Summer is peak season in Cannes, with warm temperatures perfect for beach activities and outdoor dining. The city buzzes with energy, and all attractions and restaurants are fully operational.

fall.description: Autumn offers warm days and cooler evenings, making it perfect for outdoor activities without the summer crowds. The sea remains warm enough for swimming, and the surrounding countryside displays beautiful fall colors.

winter.description: Winter in Cannes is mild compared to northern France, with temperatures rarely dropping below 10°C. While some tourist facilities may be limited, the city offers a peaceful atmosphere perfect for cultural exploration.

best_time_to_visit.summary: Cannes is best visited from late spring (May) through early fall (October), when the weather is warm and all attractions are fully operational. May is particularly special due to the Film Festival, while July and August offer the warmest temperatures and liveliest atmosphere but also bring peak crowds and higher prices. September provides an excellent balance of good weather, fewer crowds, and reasonable prices.

sites.name: Palais des Festivals et des Congrès
sites.description: The iconic venue of the prestigious Cannes Film Festival, this modern convention center hosts world-class events year-round. Walk the famous red steps where movie stars have made their mark, and explore the surrounding area filled with luxury shops and restaurants.
sites.seasonal_notes: Most exciting during the Film Festival in May. Outside film festival season, visitors can freely walk around and take photos on the famous steps.
sites.booking_tips: Free to visit exterior and lobby areas. Guided tours available during certain periods. Check festival schedule to avoid crowds.

sites.name: La Croisette
sites.description: Cannes' famous palm-lined promenade stretches along the Mediterranean coast, offering stunning sea views, luxury hotels, boutiques, and restaurants. This glamorous boulevard is perfect for people-watching and enjoying the French Riviera lifestyle.
sites.seasonal_notes: Most vibrant during summer months. Evening strolls offer the best atmosphere with stunning sunset views over the Mediterranean.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Best enjoyed at a leisurely pace with stops at beachside cafés. Parking can be expensive and difficult to find.

sites.name: Le Suquet (Old Town)
sites.description: Cannes' charming old quarter perched on a hill overlooking the bay. This picturesque area features narrow cobblestone streets, historic buildings, local restaurants, and the ancient church Notre-Dame de l'Espérance with panoramic views.
sites.seasonal_notes: Pleasant year-round, though summer can be hot for walking uphill. Spring and autumn offer ideal temperatures for exploring.
sites.booking_tips: Wear comfortable shoes for cobblestone streets and hills. Many restaurants don't take reservations - arrive early for dinner.

sites.name: Musée de la Castre
sites.description: Located in Le Suquet's medieval castle, this museum houses diverse collections including Mediterranean antiquities, ethnographic objects from around the world, and musical instruments. The museum's tower offers spectacular panoramic views of Cannes and the coast.
sites.seasonal_notes: Perfect for hot summer afternoons. The tower views are especially stunning during golden hour.
sites.booking_tips: Combined tickets with other municipal museums available. Check opening hours as they vary by season.

sites.name: Îles de Lérins
sites.description: Two peaceful islands just off Cannes' coast: Île Sainte-Marguerite with its fort and nature trails, and Île Saint-Honorat with its active monastery. These islands offer a tranquil escape with beautiful beaches, hiking paths, and historic sites.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best visited in spring and summer for ferry access and pleasant weather. Île Saint-Honorat produces wine available for tasting.
sites.booking_tips: Ferry tickets can be purchased at the port. Bring water and snacks as options are limited on the islands. Last ferries return in late afternoon.

sites.name: Plage de la Croisette
sites.description: Cannes' main beach along the famous Croisette boulevard features both public and private sections. The beach offers fine sand, clear Mediterranean waters, and views of the Lérins Islands. Private beach clubs provide luxury amenities.
sites.seasonal_notes: Peak season is July-August when beaches are crowded. May-June and September offer pleasant weather with fewer crowds.
sites.booking_tips: Public beach areas are free. Private beach clubs require reservations and fees. Arrive early for best public spots during summer.

sites.name: Marché Forville
sites.description: Cannes' vibrant covered market offering fresh produce, local specialties, flowers, and regional delicacies. This authentic Provençal market provides insight into local food culture and is perfect for picnic supplies or souvenirs.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best selection early in the morning. Closed on Mondays. Summer offers the greatest variety of fresh fruits and vegetables.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Bring cash for smaller vendors. Market closes around noon, so visit early for best selection.

sites.name: Villa Domergue
sites.description: This beautiful Art Deco villa and garden was the former home and studio of painter Jean-Gabriel Domergue. The villa showcases period art and furniture while offering stunning panoramic views over Cannes bay from its hillside location.
sites.seasonal_notes: The gardens are particularly beautiful in spring and early summer. Air-conditioned interior provides relief during hot summer days.
sites.booking_tips: Check opening hours as the villa has seasonal schedules. Photography may be restricted in certain areas.

sites.name: Port Pierre Canto
sites.description: A modern marina hosting luxury yachts and sailing boats with waterfront restaurants and bars. During the Film Festival, this becomes a hub of activity with many events and parties. Great for yacht watching and evening dining.
sites.seasonal_notes: Most active during summer months and film festival season. Evening aperitif time offers the best atmosphere for yacht watching.
sites.booking_tips: Free to walk around. Restaurant reservations recommended during peak season and festival periods.

sites.name: Boulevard de la Croisette
sites.description: The heart of Cannes' luxury district featuring high-end boutiques, designer stores, art galleries, and prestigious hotels like the Carlton and Martinez. Perfect for window shopping and experiencing Cannes' glamorous atmosphere.
sites.seasonal_notes: Most shops are open year-round. Summer crowds can make browsing challenging. Early afternoon offers a good balance of activity and accessibility.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for browsing. Many luxury stores welcome visitors even if not purchasing. Some offer complimentary services during quiet periods.

sites.name: Plage du Midi
sites.description: A more local and less crowded beach on the western side of Cannes, popular with residents and budget-conscious visitors. This sandy beach offers the same beautiful Mediterranean waters with a more relaxed, authentic atmosphere.
sites.seasonal_notes: Less crowded than Croisette beaches year-round. Parking is easier and less expensive. Perfect for families with children.
sites.booking_tips: Free access. Limited facilities compared to Croisette beaches. Bring your own refreshments and beach equipment.

sites.name: Église Notre-Dame de l'Espérance
sites.description: This historic church in Le Suquet dates back to the 16th century and offers one of the best panoramic views over Cannes, the bay, and the Lérins Islands. The church features beautiful religious art and provides insight into local religious heritage.
sites.seasonal_notes: Peaceful atmosphere in early morning hours. The terrace offers stunning views that are particularly beautiful during golden hour.
sites.booking_tips: Free entry. Respectful attire required. The climb up through Le Suquet is steep but rewarding.

sites.name: Rue d'Antibes
sites.description: Cannes' main shopping street running parallel to La Croisette, featuring a mix of international brands, local boutiques, restaurants, and cafés. This pedestrian-friendly street offers a more accessible shopping experience than the luxury Croisette.
sites.seasonal_notes: Active year-round with shops open most days. Summer brings street performers and outdoor dining. Less crowded than La Croisette.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Many shops offer tax-free shopping for tourists. Cafés are perfect for people-watching breaks.

sites.name: Plage de la Bocca
sites.description: A long stretch of sandy beach in the La Bocca district, popular with locals and offering a more authentic French Riviera experience. The beach features several beach clubs and restaurants with views toward the Esterel mountains.
sites.seasonal_notes: Excellent for summer swimming and sunbathing. Less touristy atmosphere. Spring and autumn are perfect for beach walks.
sites.booking_tips: Free public access. Several beach restaurants offer day-use facilities. Parking is easier and cheaper than central Cannes.

sites.name: Quartier de la Californie
sites.description: An upscale hillside neighborhood offering stunning views over Cannes and the Mediterranean. This area features beautiful Belle Époque villas, quiet streets perfect for walking, and several viewpoints for photography.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful year-round, though summer evenings offer the most spectacular sunset views. Spring brings blooming gardens in the villas.
sites.booking_tips: Free to explore. Wear comfortable walking shoes for hilly terrain. Best accessed by car or taxi as it's quite steep.

sites.name: Casino Barrière Cannes
sites.description: A glamorous casino in the heart of Cannes offering gaming tables, slot machines, and entertainment. The casino embodies the luxury and excitement of the French Riviera and hosts events throughout the year.
sites.seasonal_notes: Most active during evening hours and weekend nights. Special events during film festival season and summer months.
sites.booking_tips: Dress code enforced - smart casual required. Must be 18+ with valid ID. Restaurant reservations recommended for dinner.

sites.name: Médiathèque de Cannes
sites.description: A modern cultural center and library featuring contemporary architecture, exhibitions, events, and beautiful reading spaces. The building offers cultural programming and serves as a peaceful retreat from the bustling city.
sites.seasonal_notes: Air-conditioned space perfect for hot summer days. Regular cultural events and exhibitions throughout the year.
sites.booking_tips: Free entry. Check the events calendar for special exhibitions and cultural programming. WiFi available for visitors.

sites.name: Parc de la Croix des Gardes
sites.description: A large natural park on a hill overlooking Cannes, offering hiking trails, picnic areas, and panoramic views of the city, coast, and surrounding mountains. The park provides a natural escape from the urban environment.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best visited during cooler months for hiking. Spring offers wildflowers and mild temperatures. Summer visits should be early morning.
sites.booking_tips: Free access. Bring water and wear appropriate hiking shoes. Some trails can be challenging - check difficulty levels.

sites.name: Allées de la Liberté
sites.description: A charming tree-lined square in the heart of Cannes featuring a traditional pétanque court where locals gather to play the classic French game. Surrounded by cafés and shops, it offers authentic Provençal atmosphere.
sites.seasonal_notes: Most active during evening hours when locals play pétanque. Summer brings outdoor dining and increased activity.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Perfect for watching pétanque games while enjoying a drink at nearby cafés. Very authentic local experience.

sites.name: Pointe de l'Aiguille
sites.description: A scenic coastal point offering beautiful views of the Mediterranean Sea and the Esterel massif. This less-visited spot provides excellent photography opportunities and peaceful moments away from the crowds.
sites.seasonal_notes: Stunning sunset views year-round. Can be windy, especially during winter months. Spring and autumn offer ideal conditions.
sites.booking_tips: Free access. Wear appropriate footwear for walking on rocky terrain. Best reached by car or bike.

activities.name: Cannes Film Festival Preparation
activities.description: Experience the excitement building up to the world-famous Cannes Film Festival. Walk the red carpet steps, visit the Palais des Festivals, and soak in the pre-festival atmosphere.
activities.seasonal_notes: May is when Cannes transforms into the world's film capital. The city buzzes with anticipation and preparation.
activities.booking_tips: Visit early morning to avoid crowds. The red carpet is accessible year-round for photos.

activities.name: Spring Flower Market at Marché Forville
activities.description: Experience the vibrant spring flower market with colorful blooms, local produce, and the authentic atmosphere of Cannes' main market.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring brings the most beautiful flowers and fresh seasonal produce. Market is most lively on Tuesday, Thursday, and Saturday mornings.
activities.booking_tips: Arrive early for best selection. Bring a camera for the colorful displays. Try free samples from vendors.

activities.name: Coastal Walking on La Croisette
activities.description: Enjoy pleasant spring weather while strolling along the famous palm-lined promenade, taking in Mediterranean views and the elegant atmosphere.
activities.seasonal_notes: Perfect spring temperatures for walking. Fewer crowds than summer, making it ideal for photography and people-watching.
activities.booking_tips: Start early to avoid afternoon heat. Perfect time for photography with soft spring light.

activities.name: Le Suquet Historic Walking Tour
activities.description: Explore Cannes' charming old town with comfortable spring weather. Visit the medieval castle, historic church, and narrow cobblestone streets.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring offers ideal temperatures for exploring the hilly historic quarter. Beautiful light for photography.
activities.booking_tips: Wear comfortable shoes for the steep cobblestone streets. Visit the church terrace for panoramic views.

activities.name: Spring Beach Day at Plage de la Croisette
activities.description: Enjoy the beaches before the summer crowds arrive. Perfect weather for sunbathing, swimming, and beachside dining.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring offers pleasant temperatures and fewer crowds. Water may still be cool but beaches are peaceful.
activities.booking_tips: Beach clubs open in spring with better prices than peak season. Bring layers for changing temperatures.

activities.name: Provençal Cooking Workshop
activities.description: Learn to cook traditional Provençal dishes using spring ingredients like fresh herbs, seasonal vegetables, and local olive oil.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring provides the best seasonal ingredients for authentic Provençal cuisine. Perfect time to learn local culinary traditions.
activities.booking_tips: Book in advance with local cooking schools. Often includes market visits and full meal preparation.

activities.name: Island Day Trip to Île Sainte-Marguerite
activities.description: Take advantage of spring weather to visit the peaceful island with its historic fort, nature trails, and beautiful beaches.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring offers ideal conditions for island exploration. Fewer tourists and pleasant temperatures for hiking.
activities.booking_tips: Book ferry tickets in advance. Bring water and snacks as island facilities are limited.

activities.name: Spring Photography at Pointe de l'Aiguille
activities.description: Capture stunning spring landscapes at this scenic coastal point with views of the Mediterranean and Esterel massif.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring light provides excellent photography conditions. Wildflowers bloom along the coastal paths.
activities.booking_tips: Best light is 1-2 hours before sunset. Bring tripod for long exposures. Watch for coastal winds.

activities.name: Cannes Film Festival
activities.description: Experience the world's most prestigious film festival with red carpet premieres, celebrity sightings, and the glamorous atmosphere that defines Cannes.
activities.seasonal_notes: The highlight of Cannes' cultural calendar, usually held in May. The city transforms into a global film capital.
activities.booking_tips: Book accommodations and restaurants months in advance. Many events require official accreditation.

activities.name: Beach Club Experience
activities.description: Enjoy the exclusive beach clubs along La Croisette with private beach access, water sports, gourmet dining, and celebrity spotting.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer is peak season for beach clubs. Perfect weather for swimming, sunbathing, and luxury beach experiences.
activities.booking_tips: Reserve beach beds and dining well in advance. Dress codes may apply at upscale clubs.

activities.name: Sunset Sailing on the Mediterranean
activities.description: Charter a yacht or join a sailing excursion to experience the stunning Mediterranean sunset from the water, with views of the French Riviera coastline.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer provides the most spectacular sunsets and calm sea conditions. Perfect for romantic experiences.
activities.booking_tips: Book private charters or group excursions in advance. Sunset tours are most popular.

activities.name: La Croisette Evening Stroll
activities.description: Experience the glamorous evening atmosphere along the famous promenade, with luxury boutiques, elegant hotels, and the Mediterranean backdrop.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer evenings are magical with warm temperatures and vibrant atmosphere. Perfect for people-watching.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required. Best atmosphere during sunset and early evening. Many boutiques stay open late.

activities.name: Water Sports at Plage du Midi
activities.description: Enjoy water sports including jet skiing, paddleboarding, and parasailing at this local beach with excellent facilities.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer offers perfect water temperatures and calm conditions for water sports. Professional instructors available.
activities.booking_tips: Book water sports activities in advance during peak season. Equipment rental available on-site.

activities.name: Provençal Wine Tasting
activities.description: Visit local vineyards in the Provence wine region to taste rosé wines and learn about French Riviera winemaking traditions.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer harvest season offers insights into winemaking. Indoor tastings provide relief from afternoon heat.
activities.booking_tips: Book vineyard tours in advance. Often includes transportation and food pairings. Designated driver required.

activities.name: Evening Aperitif Culture
activities.description: Experience authentic French Riviera social life with evening aperitifs at waterfront cafés, watching the sunset over the Mediterranean.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer evenings are perfect for outdoor socializing. Experience the relaxed Mediterranean lifestyle.
activities.booking_tips: No booking needed for most cafés. Best spots along the waterfront. Try local rosé wine and pastis.

activities.name: Casino Barrière Cannes
activities.description: Experience the glamour of Cannes' famous casino with gaming tables, entertainment, and the sophisticated atmosphere of the French Riviera.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer brings increased activity and special events. Perfect for evening entertainment and people-watching.
activities.booking_tips: Dress code enforced - smart casual required. Must be 18+ with valid ID. Restaurant reservations recommended.

activities.name: Post-Festival Cultural Exploration
activities.description: Explore Cannes' cultural offerings after the summer crowds disperse. Visit museums, galleries, and historic sites in peaceful autumn atmosphere.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn offers fewer crowds and pleasant temperatures for cultural exploration. Museums are more accessible.
activities.booking_tips: Check for special autumn exhibitions. Many cultural venues offer reduced rates during off-season.

activities.name: Autumn Market at Marché Forville
activities.description: Experience the autumn harvest at Cannes' main market with seasonal produce, local specialties, and authentic Provençal atmosphere.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn brings seasonal specialties like truffles, mushrooms, and autumn fruits. Market is less crowded than summer.
activities.booking_tips: Visit early for best selection. Try seasonal specialties and local autumn products.

activities.name: Coastal Hiking to Cap d'Antibes
activities.description: Enjoy perfect hiking weather to explore the scenic coastal paths leading to Cap d'Antibes with stunning Mediterranean views.
activities.seasonal_notes: Ideal hiking temperatures without summer heat. Crystal clear autumn air provides spectacular coastal views.
activities.booking_tips: Start early to avoid afternoon heat. Bring camera and comfortable hiking shoes. Some trails require good fitness.

activities.name: Provençal Truffle Season
activities.description: Experience the start of truffle season in Provence, with special menus at local restaurants and truffle markets in nearby villages.
activities.seasonal_notes: Truffle season begins in autumn. Many restaurants feature special truffle menus during this period.
activities.booking_tips: Reserve at restaurants known for truffle dishes. Consider truffle hunting experiences in nearby Provence.

activities.name: Wine Harvest in Provence
activities.description: Join local vineyards during harvest season to pick grapes and learn about traditional Provençal winemaking.
activities.seasonal_notes: September to October is harvest season. Experience authentic agricultural traditions and seasonal rhythms.
activities.booking_tips: Contact local vineyards directly. Often includes meals and wine tasting. Advance booking essential.

activities.name: Storm Watching at Pointe de l'Aiguille
activities.description: Experience the dramatic autumn storms and wild seas from the safety of the coastal viewpoint, watching powerful waves crash against the rocks.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn brings more dramatic weather and spectacular storm watching opportunities. Impressive wave action.
activities.booking_tips: Check weather conditions for safety. Best during windy days. Dress warmly and bring rain protection.

activities.name: Traditional Craft Workshops
activities.description: Learn traditional Provençal crafts like pottery, textile work, or olive oil production from local artisans.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn is perfect for learning indoor crafts. Many artisans offer workshops as tourist season winds down.
activities.booking_tips: Book with local artisan associations. Often includes take-home pieces. Great for unique souvenirs.

activities.name: Mushroom Foraging in Provence
activities.description: Join guided foraging trips to discover edible mushrooms in Provençal forests, learning about local varieties and traditional uses.
activities.seasonal_notes: Peak mushroom season in Provençal forests. Important part of traditional Provençal cuisine and culture.
activities.booking_tips: Must join guided tours for safety. Often includes cooking session. Check weather for recent rain.

activities.name: Christmas Market on Allées de la Liberté
activities.description: Experience the charming Christmas market featuring local Provençal crafts, seasonal treats, and holiday decorations in the heart of Cannes.
activities.seasonal_notes: Brings festive warmth to winter evenings. Features unique Provençal holiday traditions and locally made gifts.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required. Best atmosphere in evening when lights are on. Try local holiday specialties.

activities.name: Indoor Museum Marathon
activities.description: Spend winter days exploring Cannes' excellent museums including Musée de la Castre and Villa Domergue during cooler weather.
activities.seasonal_notes: Perfect weather for indoor cultural exploration. Museums are less crowded and offer deeper exploration opportunities.
activities.booking_tips: Consider museum passes for multiple visits. Many offer guided tours. Combine with café stops for warmth.

activities.name: Traditional Provençal Winter Meals
activities.description: Enjoy hearty winter meals featuring Provençal specialties, truffles, and other traditional winter foods in cozy local restaurants.
activities.seasonal_notes: Peak season for traditional winter foods. Many restaurants feature special winter menus with seasonal ingredients.
activities.booking_tips: Reserve at traditional restaurants. Try pairing with local Provençal wines and aged cheeses.

activities.name: Thermal Springs in Provence
activities.description: Warm up in natural thermal springs in nearby Provence, a perfect winter retreat offering relaxation and therapeutic benefits.
activities.seasonal_notes: Natural hot springs provide warmth during cooler months. Beautiful winter Provençal scenery surrounding the springs.
activities.booking_tips: Check access conditions in winter. Bring towels and warm clothes for changing. Natural pools with no facilities.

activities.name: Storm Photography and Coastal Views
activities.description: Capture dramatic winter storms and moody Mediterranean seascapes from coastal viewpoints and waterfront locations.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter provides dramatic lighting and stormy seas perfect for photography. Clear post-storm days offer incredible visibility.
activities.booking_tips: Dress warmly and protect camera equipment. Best after storms when light is dramatic. Check wind conditions for safety.

activities.name: Cozy Wine Bar Evenings
activities.description: Warm up in traditional wine bars with local Provençal vintages, charcuterie platters, and the company of locals during long winter evenings.
activities.seasonal_notes: Perfect season for indoor socializing. Wine bars offer warmth, local atmosphere, and seasonal food pairings.
activities.booking_tips: No reservations usually needed. Learn basic French phrases for better interaction. Try different neighborhoods for variety.

activities.name: Winter Beach Walks
activities.description: Enjoy peaceful winter walks along the beaches with dramatic winter light, fewer crowds, and the therapeutic sound of winter waves.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter beaches offer peaceful solitude and dramatic natural beauty. Perfect for reflection and photography.
activities.booking_tips: Dress warmly and wear appropriate footwear. Best during low tide for beach exploration.

activities.name: Provençal Olive Oil Tasting
activities.description: Visit local olive mills during the winter harvest season to taste fresh olive oil and learn about traditional production methods.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter is olive harvest season in Provence. Experience the production of one of the region's most important products.
activities.booking_tips: Book tours in advance with local olive mills. Often includes tastings and product purchases.
